title: Feds Slap GM With $35 Million Penalty For Safety Law Violations
teaser: Transportation Secretary Anthony Foxx has announced that General Motors has entered into a consent decree with the U.S. government, a response to how the company handled its ignition switch recall. As part of the agreement, GM will pay a record penalty of $35 million.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
